titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Cuban Subject Collection, 1932-2004
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Cuban Subject Collection,

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 5 manuscript boxes, 5 phonorecords, 3 videotape cassettes, 4 phonotape cassettes

did.abstract: Serial issues, pamphlets, leaflets, bulletins, speeches, newsletters, reports, and sound recordings, relating to political, social and economic conditions in Cuba, Cuban foreign relations, and the status of civil liberties in Cuba, primarily in the period since the revolution of 1959.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Cuban subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1936-1994.

scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, speeches, newletters, indexes, serial issues, statistics, memorandum, report, press release, atlas, brochure, article and clipping, primarily concerning political and economic conditions, foreign policy issues and human rights

did.unittitle: AUDIOVISUAL FILE, 1971-1994.

scopecontent.p: Phonorecords of songs and speeches, and two videotapes concerning political figures and human rights

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: See card catalog for increments that may have been received since December 1994

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1936-1994
General. Pamphlets concerning Jose Marti and Maximo Gomez, 1974-1978
1933-1959. Indexes, newsletters and newspaper, 1936-1976. Includes official announcements from government of Fulgencio Batista
General. Atlas, pamphlets and booklet, primarily concerning political, judicial and foreign policy issues. Includes material on Cuban literature
Castro, Fidel. Paper and speeches, 1962-1989. Includes analysis by Maurice Halperin
Economy
Analyses. Pamphlets, 1970-1972, and transcript of speech by Paul Baran, n.d.
Statistics. Economic data published by government, 1985
Exile groups. Pamphlets and newsletter, 1960-1961. Includes material from Defensa Institucional Cubana and the Frente Revolucionario Democratico
Granada. Pamphlet containing Cuban declarations about government of Maurice Bishop, 1983
Guevara, Ernesto "Che." Speech and serial issue containing biography, 1964-1994
Human rights. Memorandum, report, press release, statement, pamphlet and clipping, 1978-1994. Includes material from Amnesty International
Partido Comunista de Cuba. Pamphlets and brochure, 1975-1987. Includes party platforms, resolutions and history
United States. Pamphlet and article concerning Cuban-American relations, 1977-1984
AUDIOVISUAL FILE, 1971-1994
Phonorecords of songs and speeches
"Discurso Pronunciado por el Companero Lazaro Pena, Secretario General de la CTC en la Constitucion del SINTAE, 6/30/73." Speech, 1973
"Tail of a Tornado - Songs of the New Cuba," performed by Silvio Rodriguez, 1981
"Cuba Va! - Songs of the New Generation of Revolutionary Cuba," 1971
"Che Guevara Speaks - Habla Che Guevara," selected speeches, 1973
Videotapes concerning political figures and human rights issues
"Nobody Listened," directed by Nestor Almendros and Jorge Ulla, 1988
"El Che Vive," documentary about Ernesto "Che" Guevara, 1994
Incremental materials

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
